results.title: Survival of spaceship earth
results.creator_credit: United Productions of America and Dirk Summers
results.brief_description: Fosters an understanding of the effects technological development and human population have had on the earth’s ecology. Features Hugh Downs, Margaret Mead, John D. Rockefeller III, Lady Barbara Ward Jackson, Harrison Brown, and Walter Orr Roberts. Narrated by Raymond Burr.

results.title: Survival in the hills
results.creator_credit: Explorer Films, Peter Halket, Maurice Dybeck and Christopher Were
results.brief_description: Aimed at anyone who is responsible in any way for mountain safety, whether as a leader or merely for themselves. Covers topics including: things that can go wrong; all aspects relating to exposure; suitable food and drinks; how to get help map and compass work; detours; accidents and simple first aid; and a summary of helpful general rules

results.title: Survival
results.creator_credit: Frank Killian, Eric L. Morris and Movietone Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Review: 26th year”
Shows many birds and animals of Australia and their methods of survival, and contrasts them with man and his recklessness on the roads.

results.title: Survival
results.creator_credit: Robert Kruger and National Coal Board
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Mining Review: 26th year”
Space age technology has turned its hand to the saving of lives at sea. A revolutionary capsule, taking the place of the conventional lifeboat, goes through its paces rescuing men from a North Sea rig.

results.title: Survey 12: on paper
results.creator_credit: Ray Harris, Michael Bongiovanni, Andrew Scollo, Robert Lindsay and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Survey (National Gallery of Victoria)”.
Part of a series which looks at individual artists and their works. This program interviews four artists, Micky Allan, Mandy Martin, Sally Robinson and Jenny Watson. Each artist discusses their philosophies, influences, subject matter, background in art, methods, materials and work. Each has been influenced by or incorporates photography in their work.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ray Harris, Michael Bongiovanni, Andrew Scollo, Robert Lindsay and Open Channel Productions

results.creator_credit: Bob Weis, Robert Lindsay, National Gallery of Victoria and Open Channel Productions
